com.miviclin.droidengine2d.gamestate

Class GameStateManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.miviclin.droidengine2d.gamestate.GameStateManager

  • public class GameStateManager
extends java.lang.Object
    GameStateManager.
    Author:
    Miguel Vicente Linares

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addOnGameStateChangeListener(OnGameStateChangeListener listener)
      Adds an OnGameStateChangeListener that will be notified when the active GameState of this GameStateManager changes.
      void dispose()
      Clears the stack of active GameStates calling popAllActiveGameStates() and calls GameState.dispose() on all GameStates registered in this GameStateManager and removes them from the GameStateManager.
      void draw(Graphics graphics)
      Calls GameState.draw(Graphics) on all the GameStates in the stack of active GameStates.
      GameState getGameState(int gameStateId)
      Returns the GameState registered with the specified gameStateId.
      void pause()
      This method is called when the engine is paused, usually when the activity goes to background.
      GameState peekActiveGameState()
      Returns the GameState at the top of the stack of active GameStates of this GameStateManager.
      void popActiveGameState()
      Pops 1 GameState off the stack of active GameStates of this GameStateManager.
      void popActiveGameStates(int numGameStatesToPop)
      Pops the specified number of GameStates off the stack of active GameStates of this GameStateManager.
      void popAllActiveGameStates()
      Pops all GameStates off the stack of active GameStates of this GameStateManager.
      void pushActiveGameState(int gameStateId)
      Pushes the GameState onto the stack of active GameStates of this GameStateManager.
      void registerGameState(int gameStateId, GameState gameState)
      Registers a GameState in this GameStateManager using the specified gameStateId.

      Registers a GameState in this GameStateManager using the specified gameStateId.
      void removeOnGameStateChangeListener(OnGameStateChangeListener listener)
      Removes an OnGameStateChangeListener from the list of listeners.
      void resume()
      This method is called when the engine is resumed, usually when the activity comes to foreground.
      void switchActiveGameState(int gameStateId)
      Replaces the GameState at the top of the stack of active GameStates of this GameStateManager with the specified GameState.
      GameState unregisterGameState(int gameStateId)
      Unregisters the specified GameState from this GameStateManager.
      void update(float delta)
      Calls GameState.update(float) on the GameState at the top of the stack of active GameStates.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameStateManager

        public GameStateManager()
        Constructor.

      • GameStateManager

        public GameStateManager(int initialCapacity)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        initialCapacity - Initial capacity for GameStates. If this capacity is reached, the data structure that holds the GameStates will be resized automatically.

    • Method Detail

      • registerGameState

        public void registerGameState(int gameStateId,
                     GameState gameState)
        Registers a GameState in this GameStateManager using the specified gameStateId.
        If a GameState with the specified gameStateId was previously registered in this GameStateManager, it will be replaced by the new one.
        Parameters:
        gameStateId - Identifier of the GameState. It can be used to get the GameState from this GameStateManager later.
        gameState - GameState (can not be null).

      • registerGameState

        public void registerGameState(int gameStateId,
                     GameState gameState,
                     boolean push)
        Registers a GameState in this GameStateManager using the specified gameStateId.
        If a GameState with the specified gameStateId was previously registered in this GameStateManager, it will be replaced by the new one.
        Parameters:
        gameStateId - Identifier of the GameState. It can be used to get the GameState from this GameStateManager later.
        gameState - GameState (can not be null).
        push - true to push the GameState onto the stack of active GameStates of this GameStateManager.

      • unregisterGameState

        public GameState unregisterGameState(int gameStateId)
        Unregisters the specified GameState from this GameStateManager.
        If a GameState was registered with the specified gameStateId, GameState.dispose() is called on the GameState before it is removed from this GameStateManager.
        If the specified GameState is in the stack of active GameStates it should be removed from the stack first, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        gameStateId - Identifier of the GameState.
        Returns:
        Removed GameState or null

      • getGameState

        public GameState getGameState(int gameStateId)
        Returns the GameState registered with the specified gameStateId.
        Parameters:
        gameStateId - Identifier of the GameState.
        Returns:
        GameState or null

      • switchActiveGameState

        public void switchActiveGameState(int gameStateId)
        Replaces the GameState at the top of the stack of active GameStates of this GameStateManager with the specified GameState.
        The GameState must have been previously registered with the specified gameStateId.
        This method notifies every OnGameStateChangeListener registered in this GameStateManager that the GameState at the top of the stack of active GameStates has changed.
        Parameters:
        gameStateId - Identifier of the GameState we want to set as the active GameState.

      • peekActiveGameState

        public GameState peekActiveGameState()
        Returns the GameState at the top of the stack of active GameStates of this GameStateManager.
        Returns:
        GameState or null

      • pushActiveGameState

        public void pushActiveGameState(int gameStateId)
        Pushes the GameState onto the stack of active GameStates of this GameStateManager.
        The GameState must have been previously registered with the specified gameStateId.
        This method notifies every OnGameStateChangeListener registered in this GameStateManager that the GameState at the top of the stack of active GameStates has changed.
        Parameters:
        gameStateId - Identifier of the GameState we want to set as the active GameState.

      • popActiveGameState

        public void popActiveGameState()
        Pops 1 GameState off the stack of active GameStates of this GameStateManager. Also calls GameState.onDeactivation() on the GameState popped off the stack.
        This method notifies every OnGameStateChangeListener registered in this GameStateManager that the GameState at the top of the stack of active GameStates has changed.

      • popActiveGameStates

        public void popActiveGameStates(int numGameStatesToPop)
        Pops the specified number of GameStates off the stack of active GameStates of this GameStateManager. Also calls GameState.onDeactivation() on all the GameStates popped off the stack.
        This method notifies every OnGameStateChangeListener registered in this GameStateManager that the GameState at the top of the stack of active GameStates has changed.
        Parameters:
        numGameStatesToPop - Number of GameStates that will be popped off the stack of active GameStates.

      • popAllActiveGameStates

        public void popAllActiveGameStates()
        Pops all GameStates off the stack of active GameStates of this GameStateManager.
        This method notifies every OnGameStateChangeListener registered in this GameStateManager that the GameState at the top of the stack of active GameStates has changed.
        See Also:
        popActiveGameStates(int)

      • addOnGameStateChangeListener

        public void addOnGameStateChangeListener(OnGameStateChangeListener listener)
        Adds an OnGameStateChangeListener that will be notified when the active GameState of this GameStateManager changes.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener to be added.

      • removeOnGameStateChangeListener

        public void removeOnGameStateChangeListener(OnGameStateChangeListener listener)
        Removes an OnGameStateChangeListener from the list of listeners. The removed listener will not be notified anymore when the active GameState of this GameStateManager changes.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener to be removed.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        This method is called when the engine is paused, usually when the activity goes to background.
        Calls GameState.onPause() on all the active GameStates.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        This method is called when the engine is resumed, usually when the activity comes to foreground.
        Calls GameState.onResume() on the active GameState.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Clears the stack of active GameStates calling popAllActiveGameStates() and calls GameState.dispose() on all GameStates registered in this GameStateManager and removes them from the GameStateManager.
        This GameStateManager will be left empty.

      • update

        public void update(float delta)
        Calls GameState.update(float) on the GameState at the top of the stack of active GameStates.
        This method is called from AbstractGame.update(float).
        Parameters:
        delta - Elapsed time, in milliseconds, since the last update.

      • draw

        public void draw(Graphics graphics)
        Calls GameState.draw(Graphics) on all the GameStates in the stack of active GameStates.
        This method is called from AbstractGame.draw(Graphics).
        This method is called from the redering thread after update(float) has been executed in the game thread.
